page.title: 16MR.B.PARKYN,THREE CROSSES
page.content: Born in 1915 in a cottage overlooking the village green at Three Crosses, Brynwell Parkyn had ambitions to become a journalist and before the outbreak of war in 1939 worked for the South Wales Evening Post.War service brought this to an end and he served with the R.A.F. in the Far East. Captured by the Japanese,he managed to escape and spent many months in the jungle with guerilla groups.Returning after the war in a state of poor health,he eventually trained as a hairdresser.Since the age of 5 he had a keen interest in painting.Self taught,painting in oils and water colours,he specialises in views of Gower.Whilst serving in Ceylon his work came to the attention of Lord Mountbatten who acquired four of his water colours.In retirement he enjoys walking and,of course, painting.
